description: The Merlion Malay: Singa-Laut; is an imaginary creature with the head of a lion and the body of a fish. Its name combines "mer" meaning the sea and "lion". The fish body comes from Singapore`s ancient name back when it was a fishing village — Temasek — meaning "sea town" in Javanese. The lion head represents Singapore`s original name — Singapura — meaning "lion city" or "kota singa".
name: Merlion
